A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This is definitely not Star Wars in the spirit of the anything to do with the originals. It felt like the director was too worried about trying to carve a name for himself to worry about taking the movie in a good direction. 
That being said if you don't approach this as a Star Wars movie at all\, and just see it as a Space Epic/Comedy\, you will rather enjoy it\, as the actors did a fantastic job. Unfortunately\, the fact that the movie feeds closer to Spaceballs than it does to Revenge of the Sith should tell you all you need to know.
I am not a purist\, and I don't just want to see a reskin of the George Lucas films\, however\, this is a film with Star Wars Characters in it. And it even announces so via the credits...
If you are a Star Wars fan\, this will leave you in doubt as to the series as you knew it. It reaks of Disney\, and not even good Disney. Fantastic movie\, but Rouge One is more Star Wars than this movie could ever hope to be.
Disney if you read this\, cancel any contracts with Rian that you have\, please let him fade into obscurity\, or you will never have enough fans left to justify your purchase. I'm sorry Rian\, this wasn't yours to try to prop your career up on. The reason the other movies were successful is that they weren't trying to be career definers\, they were telling an amazing story and never used filler content. The casino scenes\, what the hell were you thinking? The movie was long enough\, why would you waste my time?
